     yes

     if so, what would it look like - would you adapt the music to be played live by yourself, would you perform with a band, would you have a backing track, etc.?

     band. no tracks allowed on the stage, that's just a personal rule i have for my own shows. tracks are for the home. playing is for the stage

      no

      it's a loop, with a net length of 1

      every song is about love. there's really nothing i can do about that

      just long enough for my entire life to flash before my eyes

      average project. video for song. will do another one after that

      as a nay sayer,

      take all the dirt in the world and mash it together

1.14.21  9:16 am   How do I write better songs? I listen to songs I like and wonder how do I write something like that ?

      this may sound strange, but sometimes it can be a good trick to write stuff that is totally different, as different from that as possible, and then once you get that out of your system then eventually you will start writing what you wanted to write all along. Maybe you won't have to go through all that, but that is largely what i've had to do

1.12.21  8:26 pm   my mom doesn't like my music and it's really discouraging. i like my songs (for the most part, there's a few clunkers) and i know that that's what matters, but it still hurts. any advice? also, has this happened to you? 

      music is like hypnosis. the only reason people think any music is good or bad is because something about the way it was delivered has hypnotized them into a positive or negative opinion about it. You may be perfectly good at this process, but, one funny thing about the process is: it doesn't tend to work very well on close friends or family members. they already know you too well

1.12.21  8:00 pm   are there any possible tips you can give to a musician that wants to get better at their craft?

      how about doing .............. music

1.12.21  3:01 am   Question: When you've written down your first thoughts and impulses of a song when inspiration hits you, then the "well" of inspiration has ran dry, when you come back to the unfinished song later how do you finish it?

     the first thing is to figure out if that piece is the beginning or not the beginning. If it's the beginning, then, run through it and see if you know what comes next. if it's not the beginning then you're kinda fucked. It's almost impossible to figure out what should come before, but maybe if you can get what's next then soon it may want to come full circle. then somewhere around the circle has got to be the starting point
